questions.question_text:
A Marketing Cloud admin is asked to add a set of four query strings automatically to all the links in an email sent via Email Studio.
Which solution should the admin suggest?

A Marketing Cloud admin is asked by the marketing team to ensure a default Header and Footer be added to emails.
Where under Setup could this be created?

discussion.content:
Unfortunately, A and B are right:
"You can set this information in Email Studio as part of the send classification, or you can customize how the headers and footers appear at an account level."
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_es_headers_footers.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: A
A is correct as described by others (not Kyashii (he is scam))

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct, just go through the Marketing Cloud Salesforce

comments.content: A is correct. Setup > Settings > Company Settings > Account Settings > Headers and Footers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

choices.B: Keyword is used within another business unit
choices.A: Keyword fails to meet content standards

questions.question_text:
A Marketing Cloud admin wants to configure a new keyword for an upcoming SMS campaign. After entering the desired keyword CELEBRATE the admin notices the keyword is unavailable.
What issue could the admin be facing?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Keywords created at a business unit level, whether parent or child, remain available only to that business unit.


https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_moc_managing_keywords_on_short_and_long_codes_in_your_mobileconnect_accounts.htm&type=5
NOTE Keywords created at a business unit level, whether parent or child, remain available only to that business unit.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

Selected Answer: B
Marketing Cloud Administrator is the role for Marketing Cloud, but it does not include Email Studio. For this the Email Studio "Administrator" is necessary.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_overview_roles.htm&type=5
Administrator includes only Email studio and MC Administrator includes all the rest (except Email Studio). So to have FULL access, you need both

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

comments.content: I am confused as to why "B" is the case. Can you explain?

choices.A: Data Manager and Marketing Cloud Administrator
choices.C: Marketing Cloud Security Administrator and Administrator
